options.content: [[cluster]]

panels.description: Number of nodes that reported their status as Starting or Joining
panels.title: Joining

panels.description: Number of nodes that reported their status as  Leaving, Decommissioned, Draining or Drained
panels.title: Leaving

panels.description: The percentage of the time during which Scylla utilized the CPU. Note that because Scylla does busy polling for some time before going idle, CPU utilization as seen by the operating system may be much higher. Your system is not yet CPU-bottlenecked until this metric is high.
panels.title: Load

styles.linkTooltip: Jump to the detailed node information
Jump to the OS node information
Jump to the Advanced metrics information
Jump to the see the node
Jump to the see the node

targets.expr: $func(rate(scylla_alternator_op_latency_sum{instance=~"[[node]]",cluster=~"$cluster|$^", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]|$^", op="$alternator_latency_ops"}[60s])) by ([[by]])/($func(rate(scylla_alternator_op_latency_count{instance=~"[[node]]",cluster=~"$cluster|$^", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]|$^", op="$alternator_latency_ops"}[60s])) by ([[by]]) + 1)

histogram_quantile(0.95, sum(rate(scylla_alternator_op_latency_bucket{instance=~"[[node]]",cluster=~"$cluster|$^", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]|$^", op="$alternator_latency_ops"}[60s])) by ([[by]], le))

histogram_quantile(0.99, sum(rate(scylla_alternator_op_latency_bucket{instance=~"[[node]]",cluster=~"$cluster|$^", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]|$^", op="$alternator_latency_ops"}[60s])) by ([[by]], le))

$func(rate(scylla_alternator_op_latency_sum{instance=~"[[node]]",cluster=~"$cluster|$^", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]|$^", op="$alternator_streams_latency_ops"}[60s])) by ([[by]])/($func(rate(scylla_alternator_op_latency_count{instance=~"[[node]]",cluster=~"$cluster|$^", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]|$^", op="$alternator_streams_latency_ops"}[60s])) by ([[by]]) + 1)

panels.description: Number of rows that were read from the cache, without needing to be fetched from storage.
panels.title: Cache Hits

panels.description: Number of rows that were not present in the cache, and had to be fetched from storage.
panels.title: Cache Misses

panels.description: Requests that Scylla tried to write but timed out. Timeouts are counted in the node that received the request (the coordinator), not at the replicas.
panels.title: Write Timeouts/Minutes by [[by]]

panels.description: Requests that Scylla tried to read but timed out. Timeouts are counted in the node that received the request (the coordinator), not at the replicas.
panels.title: Read Timeouts/Minutes by [[by]]

panels.description:
This graph panel was left empty on purpose for ad-hoc usage. Change it when needed. Pay attention that changes to the panel will not be saved.

If you do need a panel that can be saved, create a new dashboard, or edit the panel inside the json file
panels.title: Your Graph here
